intro: Bumelia dominicana, commonly known as the Mexican buckthorn, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with distinctive floral structures. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Bumelia dominicana is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
